Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Imam Al-Hajj Talib Abdur-Rashid, The Mosque of Islamic Brotherhood, 130 West 113th Street, New York, N.Y. 10026.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Dickens.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Imam Al-Hall Talib Abdur-Rashid, The Mosque of Islamic Brotherhood, 130 West 113th Street, New York, N.Y. 10026..

On behalf 
of Council Member Dickens, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 870, also known as, the Puerto Rico Chapter 9 Uniformity Act of 2015.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 3 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Ulrich, Vallone and Matteo.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Puerto Rico Chapter 9 Uniformity Act of 2015. (H.R. 870)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign the Improving the Treatment of the U.S. Territories Under Federal Health Programs Act of 2015 (H.R. 2635), which would make improvements to the treatment of the United States territories under the Medicare and Medicaid programs
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Ulrich and Matteo.


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Improving the Treatment of the U.S. Territories Under Federal Health Programs Act of 2015 (H.R. 2635)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign legislation allowing an economic hardship exemption for Puerto Rico from the Merchant Marine Act of 1920, commonly known as the “Jones Act.”
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Ulrich and Matteo.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Merchant Marine Act of 1920, commonly known as the “Jones Act.”

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There are two vacancies in the Council pending the swearing-in of the respective winners of the Nov. 2015 General Elections to be held in the 23rd and 51st Districts.

There were 44 Council Members present at this Stated Meeting.
The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
